views.description: This view contains a list of all deals that are available for consideration and previously closed deals, and their expected investment size and expected rate of return. This table contains TARGET information and There are no details in this entity on existing financial performance, returns, current valuations or the share price.
views.selector: Use this view when the question references an active deal, or the current deal. Use this view when the query involves ongoing deals, particularly when discussing target metrics such as target internal rate of return (IRR), initial investment size, ticket size, target moic, platform-specific details, or any characteristics related to deals that are in progress.**ALSO use as fallback when aggregated views cannot provide sufficient filter coverage for deal-level analysis.** Additionally, use this view when the query wants to obtain the expected rate of returns, and other financial metrics for the current deal, or other active deals. Data for investments exists in other views. If the deal does not exist in this view, instead, use other investment views.

columns.name: DEAL_ID
columns.definition: A unique identifier that is automatically generated for each deal

columns.name: SOURCE_DEAL_ID
columns.definition: Column SOURCE_DEAL_ID from ACTIVE_DEAL_LIST_VW

columns.name: DEAL_NAME
columns.definition: An internal name assigned to a deal to ensure confidentiality

columns.name: SHORT_DESCR
columns.definition: A short description of a deal

columns.name: PLATFORM
columns.definition: Mubadala’s Business Platform, Corporate Platform or Group CEO & Managing Director Platform

columns.name: BUSINESS_UNIT
columns.definition: Any subdivision of a Business Platform, which is headed by an Executive Director or any individual designated by the relevant Business Platform CEO to carry out the authorities of such function within their Units.

columns.name: INVESTMENT_CLASS
columns.definition: A class of an investment.

columns.name: ASSET_CLASS
columns.definition: A grouping of investments that exhibit similar characteristics and are subject to the same laws and regulations. These include Public Equity, Venture Capital, Private Equity, Real Estate, Infrastructure, Bonds, Credit, Hedge Funds, Derivatives and Cash

columns.name: ASSET_SUB_CLASS

columns.name: DEAL_STATUS

columns.definition: Column TARGET_ID from ACTIVE_DEAL_LIST_VW

columns.name: TARGET_NAME
columns.definition: Column TARGET_NAME from ACTIVE_DEAL_LIST_VW

columns.name: PARTNERS
columns.definition: A Partner (or Fund Manager) responsible for managing the trading activities of the fund. The primary counterparty or organization directly involved in a specific investment. If the prompt refers to 'Partner', you can use this column. As multiple partners may be listed, use partial matching (%) to retrieve relevant investments.

columns.name: DEAL_STAGE
columns.definition: Stage of the deal in the investment lifecycle. Closed deals Mubadala no longer has an interest in or a stake in. The deal pipeline is considered to be deals up to and including the signing stage.

columns.name: DEAL_LEAD
columns.definition: The investment professional leading the deal from origination, structuring and negotiation, through to approval and execution

columns.name: FINAL_APPROVING_COMMITTEE_PRES_DATE
columns.definition: Date the deal is presented to the final approving committee. Use this as the proposed completion year for the deal being finalised. Formatted YYYY-MM-DD.

columns.name: TARGET_IRR
columns.definition: The desired target percentage Internal Rate of Return (IRR) on this deal. When users ask for 'IC Case IRR', they are referring to TARGET_IRR.

columns.name: TARGET_MOIC
columns.definition: The desired target Multiple on Investment Capital (MOIC or also known as TVPI) on the deal. This is the ratio of the total value (distributions + residual value) relative to the total capital contributed by investors. Expressed as a decimal, where positive values indicate total value exceeding paid-in capital, and negative values indicate total value below paid-in capital. When users ask for 'IC Case MOIC', they are referring to TARGET_MOIC.

columns.name: INVESTMENT_SIZE_USD
columns.definition: Value of initial input investment (in millions) that Mubadala will make in the investment in USD. This is not the return on the investment.

columns.name: INVESTMENT_SIZE_AED
columns.definition: Value of initial input investment (in millions) that Mubadala will make in the investment in AED. This is not the return on the investment.

columns.name: OWNERSHIP_STAKE

views.description: This view contains TIMESTAMPED key performance indicators for each investment that Mubadala has made. It includes the internal rate of return (IRR), Multiple on Investment Capital (MOIC or TVPI), Value Creation, DVPI, RVPI, Loss Ratio and other financial metrics. These metrics are at an individual investment level. Additionally, this view includes the region of the fund, country, asset class, investment. This table contains timestamped data for each investment at regular intervals within the financial years - only take the latest data for each deal unless the user is asking how it has changed overtime or a specific time interval.
views.selector: Use this view if a question references an investment or a historical deal, but not the current deal, specifically at a historical deal level or is requesting historical deals / investments that match a particular filter.**ALSO use as fallback when aggregated views lack required filter dimensions . Common uses include questions related to the financial performance of a specific investment, the return on investment, the internal rate of return, the multiple on investment capital, and other financial metrics. Use this view when the question is related to the performance of a specific investment or historical deal. If the question is related to the performance of a platform or business unit, use appropriate platform or business unit KPI views. Always use this view in parallel, if you use the 'ACTIVE_DEAL_LIST_VW'.

columns.name: AS_ON_DATE_ID
columns.definition: Date the calculation was made expressed in the form YYYYMMDD. Always take the latest entry by date, unless asked to compare across dates, or the question targets a different time range or multi-years worth of data is needed for a calculation.

columns.name: YEAR
columns.definition: Year the calculation was made expressed in the form YYYY.

columns.name: RECORD_TYPE
columns.definition: Record type indicating the period for calculation - includes quarterly data (Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4) and year-to-date (YTD) information. This field helps identify whether the metrics are for a specific quarter or cumulative year-to-date performance.

columns.definition: Mubadala’s Business Platform, Corporate Platform or Group CEO & Managing Director Platform

columns.definition: Any subdivision of a Business Platform, which is headed by an Executive Director or any individual designated by the relevant Business Platform CEO to carry out the authorities of such function within their Units.

columns.name: YTD_TOTAL_PROCEEDS
columns.definition: The total proceeds (fair market value minus cash invested) from the investment, over the period from start of the calendar year to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end) in AED.

columns.name: ITD_TOTAL_PROCEEDS

columns.name: ITD_CASH_PROCEEDS
columns.definition: Column ITD_CASH_PROCEEDS from INVESTMENT_KPI_VW

columns.name: ITD_RETURN
columns.definition: The percentage Internal Rate of Return (IRR) from inception to measurement date of the investment. This should be compared against the other IRR / Return metrics.

columns.name: YTD_RETURN
columns.definition: The percentage Internal Rate of Return (IRR) generated over the period from start of the calendar year to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end). This should be compared against the other IRR / RETURN metrics.

columns.name: YTD_3_RETURN
columns.definition: The percentage Internal Rate of Return (IRR) generated over the period from start of the calendar year, 3 years ago, to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end). This should be compared against the other IRR / RETURN metrics.

columns.name: YTD_4_RETURN
columns.definition: The percentage Internal Rate of Return (IRR) generated over the period from start of the calendar year, 4 years ago, to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end). This should be compared against the other IRR / RETURN metrics.

columns.name: YTD_5_RETURN
columns.definition: The percentage Internal Rate of Return (IRR) generated over the period from start of the calendar year, 5 years ago, to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end). This should be compared against the other IRR / RETURN metrics.

columns.name: ITD_CASH_INVESTED
columns.definition: The total amount of cash invested in AED from inception to date. Always represented as a negative value as it is an outflow. Always represented as a negative value as it is an outflow.

columns.name: YTD_VALUE_CREATION
columns.definition: The change in Unrealized Value plus Net Cashflow over the period from start of the calendar year to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end) in AED

columns.name: YTD_3_VALUE_CREATION
columns.definition: The change in Unrealized Value plus Net Cashflow over the period from start of the calendar year, 3 years ago, to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end) in AED

columns.name: YTD_4_VALUE_CREATION
columns.definition: The change in Unrealized Value plus Net Cashflow over the period from start of the calendar year, 4 years ago, to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end) in AED

columns.name: YTD_5_VALUE_CREATION
columns.definition: The change in Unrealized Value plus Net Cashflow over the period from start of the calendar year, 5 years ago, to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end) in AED

columns.name: ITD_VALUE_CREATION
columns.definition: The change in Unrealized Value plus Net Cashflow from the inception date for the investment in AED.

columns.name: NUMBER_OF_SHARES
columns.definition: Number of shares in a public investment

columns.name: DAILY_SHARE_PRICE
columns.definition: Price per share of a public investment in AED

columns.name: DVPI
columns.definition: The Distributed to Paid-In Capital (DVPI). This is the ratio of distributions (cash or stock returned to investors) to the total capital contributed by investors. It reflects the realized returns of an investment fund. Expressed as a decimal, where positive values indicate distributions exceeding paid-in capital, and negative values indicate distributions below paid-in capital.

columns.name: RVPI
columns.definition: The Residual Value to Paid-In Capital (RVPI). This is the ratio of the remaining value of an investment fund (unrealized gains) to the total capital contributed by investors. It reflects the unrealized returns of the fund. Expressed as a decimal, where positive values indicate residual value exceeding paid-in capital, and negative values indicate residual value below paid-in capital.

columns.name: STIP
columns.definition: Column STIP from INVESTMENT_KPI_VW

columns.name: LOSS_RATIO
columns.definition: The proportion of losses incurred relative to the total capital invested, expressed as a decimal between 0 and -1. Always represented as a negative value as it is an outflow.

columns.name: INITIAL_INVESTEMENT_DATE
columns.definition: Date the initial investment was made by Mubadala. Formatted YYYY-MM-DD.

columns.name: FLEXFIELD1
columns.definition: Column FLEXFIELD1 from INVESTMENT_KPI_VW

columns.name: ACTUAL_MOIC
columns.definition: The Multiple on Investment Capital (MOIC or also known as TVPI). This is the ratio of the total value (distributions + residual value) relative to the total capital contributed by investors. Expressed as a decimal, where positive values indicate total value exceeding paid-in capital, and negative values indicate total value below paid-in capital. This should be compared to other MOIC metrics.

columns.name: REFORECAST_MOIC
columns.definition: The forecasted MOIC (also known as TVPI) at the predicted exit point. This is the ratio of the total value (distributions + residual value) relative to the total capital contributed by investors. Expressed as a decimal, where positive values indicate total value exceeding paid-in capital, and negative values indicate total value below paid-in capital. This should be compared to other MOIC metrics.

columns.name: VINTAGE
columns.definition: Year the initial investment was made by Mubadala. Formatted YYYY-MM-DD.

columns.name: REFORECAST_RETURN
columns.definition: The forecasted percentage Internal Rate of Return (IRR) at the predicted exit point. This should be compared against the other IRR / Return metrics.

columns.name: TARGET_RETURN
columns.definition: The desired target percentage Internal Rate of Return (IRR) on this deal. This should be compared against the other IRR / Return metrics. When users ask for 'IC Case IRR', they are referring to TARGET_RETURN.

columns.name: TARGET_MOIC
columns.definition: The desired target Multiple on Investment Capital (MOIC or also known as TVPI) on the deal. This is the ratio of the total value (distributions + residual value) relative to the total capital contributed by investors. Expressed as a decimal, where positive values indicate total value exceeding paid-in capital, and negative values indicate total value below paid-in capital. This should be compared to other MOIC metrics. When users ask for 'IC Case MOIC', they are referring to TARGET_MOIC.

columns.name: TICKET_SIZE_USD
columns.definition: The approved target value of the initial input investment (in millions) that Mubadala will make in the investment in USD. This is not the return on the investment.

columns.name: TICKET_SIZE_AED
columns.definition: The approved target value of the initial input investment (in millions) that Mubadala will make in the investment in AED. This is not the return on the investment.

columns.name: PARTNERS
columns.definition: A Partner (or Fund Manager) responsible for managing the trading activities of the fund. The primary counterparty or organization directly involved in a specific investment. If the prompt refers to 'Partner', you can use this column. As multiple partners may be listed, use partial matching (%) to retrieve relevant investments.

columns.name: DVPI
columns.definition: The Distributed to Paid-In Capital (DVPI). This is the ratio of distributions (cash or stock returned to investors) to the total capital contributed by investors. It reflects the realized returns of an investment fund. Expressed as a decimal, where positive values indicate distributions exceeding paid-in capital, and negative values indicate distributions below paid-in capital.

columns.name: RVPI
columns.definition: The Residual Value to Paid-In Capital (RVPI). This is the ratio of the remaining value of an investment fund (unrealized gains) to the total capital contributed by investors. It reflects the unrealized returns of the fund. Expressed as a decimal, where positive values indicate residual value exceeding paid-in capital, and negative values indicate residual value below paid-in capital.

columns.definition: The percentage Internal Rate of Return (IRR) generated over the period from start of the calendar year to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end). This should be compared against the other IRR / RETURN metrics.

columns.name: YTD_3_RETURN
columns.definition: The percentage Internal Rate of Return (IRR) generated over the period from start of the calendar year, 3 years ago, to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end). This should be compared against the other IRR / RETURN metrics.

columns.name: YTD_4_RETURN
columns.definition: The percentage Internal Rate of Return (IRR) generated over the period from start of the calendar year, 4 years ago, to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end). This should be compared against the other IRR / RETURN metrics.

columns.name: YTD_5_RETURN
columns.definition: The percentage Internal Rate of Return (IRR) generated over the period from start of the calendar year, 5 years ago, to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end). This should be compared against the other IRR / RETURN metrics.

columns.name: UNREALIZED_VALUE

columns.name: YTD_TOTAL_PROCEEDS
columns.definition: The total proceeds (fair market value minus cash invested) from the investment, over the period from start of the calendar year to the in year measurement date (usually month or quarter end) in AED.

columns.name: ITD_CASH_INVESTED
columns.definition: The total amount of cash invested in AED from inception to date. Always represented as a negative value as it is an outflow.

columns.name: YTD_CASH_INVESTED

views.description: This view contains TIMESTAMPED information on allocated capital, consumption, and remaining balances segmented by platform and year. It includes historical and projected allocations with carryover calculations.
views.selector: Use this view if the question references allocated and consumed capital for a given platform by year, including carryover balances and allocation adjustments.

columns.name: PLATFORM
columns.definition: Mubadala’s Business Platform, Corporate Platform or Group CEO & Managing Director Platform

columns.name: YEAR
columns.definition: Year the calculation was made expressed in the form YYYY.

columns.name: ALLOCATION_APPROVED_AED_MN
columns.definition: The originally approved allocation amount for the platform in the given year, expressed in millions of AED. This is the original budget allocated to the platform for that year. This does not include carryover.

columns.name: ALLOCATION_ADJUSTMENTS
columns.definition: Any adjustments made to the original approved allocation during the year, expressed in millions of AED

columns.name: CONSUMPTION
columns.definition: The actual amount of allocated capital consumed/spent by the platform during the year, expressed in millions of AED

columns.name: REMAINING_BALANCE
columns.definition: The remaining unspent allocation balance at the end of the year, calculated as approved allocation plus adjustments minus consumption, expressed in millions of AED. This does not include carryover from previous years.

columns.name: FINAL_BALANCE_UPDATE_CARRYOVER
columns.definition: The final remaining balance including carryover from previous years that can be utilized in future periods calculated as approved allocation plus adjustments plus carryover minus consumption. This is the final remaining amount of capital available for the platform after accounting for carryover from previous years.

columns.name: FINAL_ALLOCATION_APPROVED_CARRYOVER
columns.definition: The total approved allocation including carryover amounts from previous years, representing the total capital available for allocation, expressed in millions of AED. This is the final budget allocated to the platform for that year, including any carryover from previous years.

columns.name: AS_OF_DATE
columns.definition: Column AS_OF_DATE from ALLOCATION_VW

columns.name: INSERTED_DTTM
columns.definition: Timestamp when the record was inserted into the database system
